message: Non here all at your house

Addiction is never truly a choice. It ALWAYS begins due to physical or psychological trauma that makes the victim seek any escape from unbearable pain. People in bad situations find company in misery then get into dangerous party scenes or medicate alone to escape the trauma. Then even if they get over the original trauma, they are forever left with a chemical addiction. Anyone who hasn't experienced chemical addiction can't ever understand. Your mind becomes completely hijacked. All your intelligence, skills and strength are focused into using the substance. A full-blown addict would easily sell his own children, destroy his own body or steal from his own mother because the mind is warped and justifies EVERYTHING to get the drug. The mind of a non-addict will never truly understand the disease. If you've been there, you see it is NOT A CHOICE and people have to be physically restrained by others when addiction is full blown to stop killing themselves. How is that not mental illness? And like with any mental illness, addicts are never completely healed. They have to play mental tricks to fight addiction 24/7, seek therapy, sometimes take medication and are always one weak moment away from relapse.
I once knew an insurance salesman who was an anti abortion leader in my town. His insurance company wouldn't pay life insurance claims unless the child was at least two years old.
